headline: The S&P 500's Dividend Yield Is the Lowest It's Been in Over 2 Decades. Here's Where You Can Lock in Much Higher Yields.
summary: The S&P 500 has gained an impressive 35% over the past year.  Because of that, its dividend yield has fallen from 1.7% a year ago to around 1.2% these days.  To put that into a more tangible context, a $10,000 investment made in the S&P 500 right now would only produce about $120 of dividend income over the next year.
